page.title: 17HOUSES/GARDENS OF SE BOLDRE
page.content: There are no Stately Homes here and 2 of the largest houses are now schools. Of the rest most date from the 19th C. and later.However there are several lovely old cottages and farmhouses lovingly restored and delightful to see.The Fleur de Lys pub is extremely old and has a list of landlords going back to the 13th C.There are modern Council homes and many no-nonsense small dwellings.Nearly all,large or small are greatly enhanced by their gardens.Gardening is a popular hobby in Boldre and the area as the annual Produce Show testifies.Fruit,flowers and vegetables thrive in the soil and blossom into beauty with the hard work and dedication they receive.The first school meals service was started at the William Gilpin School and for a while they grew their own vegetables. Our gardens are practical& pleasurable
